comment.author: 77541634@N00
comment._content: Is the tower the same as this one in Barrack St from the Powerhouse Museum collection? I'm trying to work out angles. If it's the same tower it looks like the current 83 Castlereigh St is further to the south from where this was taken.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Paul, I think you're right., the top of the tower looks the same in both images, doesn't it. I think the location of some street numbers have been known to change/move over time.

comment.author: 47572660@N08
comment._content:
Hi! There are two things worthy of comment about this image. Firstly, was there an opera house in Sydney at the time? Secondly, is 'Opera House Hotel' a previous name, as I notice the name 'Simcock's Hotel' on a window, where the original name would have been easier to replace?
Question for State Records: are you interested in a quality image of the floral clock at Taronga Zoo with the Harbour Bridge in the background, circa mid-1930s? If so, please advise where to upload. Regards

comment.author: 29029178@N03
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Pubs of Australia, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content:
Likely to date to 1888, as it has precisely the same "vignetting" as this Castlereagh St. photo:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/3810093093/]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
32162360@N00
comment._content: The building on the left was the Theatre Royal, also known previously as The Prince of Wales Opera House (which explains the Hotel name). See history - www.hat-archive.com/theatre_royal_sydney_to_1913.htm Photo - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=169633 1895 map (which explains the GPO tower in the right background) - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-rm3443-sd&rgn=0...
